title: 08. Pericles’ Funeral Oration
description: Themes and historical interpretation of Pericles’ Funeral Oration during the early Peloponnesian War.

questions.question: In what context was Pericles’ Funeral Oration delivered?
options: At a public funeral for those killed in the first year of the Peloponnesian War
At the opening of the Peloponnesian War

questions.question: Where was the Funeral Oration traditionally delivered?
options: In the public cemetery of Athens

questions.question: What was the expected purpose of a funeral speech in Athens?
options: To describe the battle in detail
To praise the city and justify the deaths of the fallen

questions.question: Why does Pericles say his task as speaker is difficult?
options: The dead are unknown to him
Praising the dead risks either understatement or exaggeration

questions.question: What political system does Pericles praise in the speech?
What claim does Pericles make about equality in Athens?
options: Advancement depends on merit rather than birth
Equality applies only in the law courts

questions.question: How does Pericles describe Athenian foreign policy?
options: Open and confident rather than secretive

questions.question: Which state is used as a contrast to Athens in the speech?
How does Pericles portray Athenian freedom in private life?
options: Citizens tolerate differences in personal behaviour

questions.question: What quality does Pericles emphasise about Athenian courage?
What does Pericles say motivates Athenians to fight for the city?
What does Pericles urge the living Athenians to do?
options: Live up to the standards set by the dead

questions.question: Which group does Pericles briefly address towards the end of the speech?
What advice does Pericles give to women?
options: To attract as little attention as possible

questions.question: Why must historians treat the speech with caution?
options: Thucydides admits he shaped speeches to convey meaning

questions.question: What additional claim does Plato make about the speech?
options: That Pericles copied it from another city
That Aspasia may have helped write it
